subject: Re: Sarah Estep
author: judy_in_hollywood
full_text:
Hi All, I was able to get Sarah's book, "Voices Of Eternity", not long ago from Ebay = what a great book it is & so inspiring!!!  I hadn't heard she is sick or anything . . . what's going on with her? I'd like to send out Prayers her way! Thanks.  =Judy=                                                   
--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "psi_research" <vilhellm@...> wrote:
>
> Sarah is such a brave visionary. Jen & I met her at the Atlanta AA-EVP 
> meeting a few years ago and she was surprised that attendees wanted 
> their photos taken with her and asked for her autograph. It's folks 
> like her and others in this field, including some of the participants 
> of this forum, that keep the research moving forward.
> 
> We'll make sure Sarah is in our thoughts during this holiday season. -
> Bill
> 
> --- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Lisby <lisby@> wrote:
> >
> > As most of us know, Sarah Estep, was the founder of the AA-EVP--the  
> > route by I, and many of us, first got to the place we're at today.  
> > I've heard from a friend of mine who is also of that generation of  
> > EVP tapers, that Sarah's condition is deteriorating. I'd like to ask  
> > all of you to send positive thoughts her way, as she was always a  
> > very gracious lady who was more than helpful to many, many people 
> who  
> > were interested in taping. I bought my first equipment from Sarah's  
> > husband and benefited greatly from her wisdom, always given freely.  
> > She will be remembered as giant in this field.
> > 
> > Please think of her kindly this Christmas Eve.
> > 
> > Ann
> >
>
